greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle of 5^k mod prime(n).
comment: Except for the third row, the first term of each row is 1. Many sequences are in this one: starting at A036121 (mod 23) and A070365 (mod 7).
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n = 1..60, flattened
mathematica: nn = 10; p = 5; t = p^Range[0,Prime[nn]]; Flatten[Table[If[Mod[n, p] == 0, {0}, tm = Mod[t, n]; len = Position[tm, 1, 1, 2][[-1,1]]; Take[tm, len-1]], {n, Prime[Range[nn]]}]]
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Dec 07 2011
